quote: The revolution is not a gift. We have to fight for it.
author: Angela Davis (African-American activist)

quote: Feminism isn't about making women strong. Women are already strong. It's about changing the way the world perceives that strength.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie (Nigerian novelist)

quote: We cannot all succeed when half of us are held back.
author: Malala Yousafzai (Pakistani activist for female education)

quote: A woman with a voice is by definition a strong woman.
author: Meena Harris (American lawyer and author)

quote: My biggest enemy is not sexism. It's apathy.
author: Aisha Yesufu (Nigerian activist)

quote: You don't have to be wealthy to be a philanthropist.
author: Jacinda Ardern (Prime Minister of New Zealand)

quote: There is no limit to what we, as women, can accomplish.
author: Michelle Obama (Former First Lady of the United States)

quote: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
author: Victoria Abril (Spanish actress)

quote: Feminism isn't about making women strong. It's about changing the world to make equality a reality.
author: Emma Watson (British actress and activist)

quote: The thing that is still missing is to just see a woman as an equal human being.
author: Yoko Ono (Japanese multimedia artist)

quote: We need women at all levels, including the top, to change the dynamics of power, decision-making and resource allocation.
author: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka (South African politician)

quote: Doubt is a disease. Make peace with yourself.
author: Jeanne Moreau (French actress)

quote: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou (American poet and activist)

quote: There is no force more powerful than a woman determined to rise.
author: Wangari Maathai (Kenyan environmental and political activist)

quote: Femininity needs to be embraced wherever it is, whether it be in a man or a woman or a gender non-conforming person.
author: Munroe Bergdorf (British transgender rights activist)

quote: Feminism isn't about making women strong. Women are already strong. It's about changing the way the world perceives that strength.
author: G.D. Anderson

quote: Feminism isn't about hating men. It's about challenging the absurd gender distinctions that boys and girls learn from childhood and carry into their adult lives.
author: Chrissy Stockton

quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.
author: Cheris Kramarae

quote: Feminism is not just about women; it’s about letting everyone live their life without being boxed into gender stereotypes.
author: Emma Watson

quote: Feminism is not a dirty word. It does not mean you hate men, it does not mean you hate girls that have nice legs and a tan, and it does not mean you are a ‘bitch’ or ‘dyke’, it means you believe in equality.
author: Kate Nash
